body:
recently i've found that a great ctw strategy is to go around and get every wool, then go back to base.
here's a pic if you dont know what im talking about: http://imgur.com/ZAPbUMw
it gets you a lot of creds, finishes the game quickly and confuses everyone when the game suddenly ends. if you've ever successfully done this, feel free to comment below.

what are people's other favorite ctw strategies? there are topics like this for dtm and walls and stuff but i haven't seen one for ctw yet.
body_tagged:

title: ctw strategies

replies.body:
I think a lot of people already use the grab every wool technique ^

For me, I just rush onto the other team's side, grab some wool and flee for dear life.
replies.body_tagged:
I think a lot of people already use the grab every wool technique ^

For me, I just rush onto the other team's side, grab some wool and flee for dear life.

replies.body:
Triple capping isn't easy... nice work for accomplishing it. 

Once I get the wool, I just spam it as I make my way back to spawn, that way when I die, my teammates can pick up my wool and score anyway.
replies.body_tagged:
Triple capping isn't easy... nice work for accomplishing it. 

Once I get the wool, I just spam it as I make my way back to spawn, that way when I die, my teammates can pick up my wool and score anyway.

replies.body: Safety wools don't work on Avicus, as far as I know.

replies.body:
whats hybrid blocking??

is it just a mixture of block hitting and normal hitting??

reply_to.body:
Or you can just hybrid-block the living cr*p out of everyone knocking them 10 blocks away and getting into the wool.
ezz
reply_to.body_tagged:
Or you can just hybrid-block the living cr*p out of everyone knocking them 10 blocks away and getting into the wool.

replies.body: Essentially. You time your blocks in order to achieve maximum knockback.
replies.body_tagged: Essentially. You time your blocks in order to achieve maximum knockback.
